WRITING.TITLE: Individuals Who Believe in the Paranormal Develop More Causal Illusions than Nonbelievers in the Laboratory
People who claim to be experts in a topic are more likely to fall for made up facts on that topic.
Analysis shows that pesticide residues in food are at levels far below those that would pose any health concern.
Failure to attain a high school degree is associated with a higher risk of premature death. The researchers suggest that a lack of education leads to the adoption of unhealthy behaviors.
Top scientists are reporting signs of life on comet 67P. "I am here to make a prediction: this claim will vanish, never to be heard from again."
Researchers have found the first evidence for STDs in honeybees.
Pre-crastination: Why the opposite of procrastination can be just as bad.
KFC Plagued By Urban Legends Fueled by Psychology
Primatologists have recorded the first spontaneous case of a chimpanzee drumming in a way that resembles music.
Online communication as a window to conspiracist worldviews
Is there a limit to temperature?
Researchers envision Earth as a giant computer, determine its storage capacity and power by calculating the total amount of DNA and the overall rate of DNA transcription.

WRITING.TEXT: Not sure I'm buying Kate Mara as Johanssen. Hopefully she'll prove me wrong.

WRITING.TITLE: How Creationism can be used in science classes to teach the scientific method.
Why Creationism Belongs in Science Class: A professor teaches creationism in her classes in order to have students debunk it with the scientific method.
Insect Mating Behavior Has Lessons for Drones
Scientists move one step closer to mimicking gamma-ray bursts
New discovery could lead to sunscreen in pill form.

Study links infections to a decrease in cognitive ability. The researchers found that the more times a subject was hospitalized for an infection throughout his life, the lower he scored on a test of cognitive ability.
Exposure of US population to extreme heat could quadruple by mid-century
There's a particle accelerator in the Louvre.
New analysis finds that if the world built nuclear power at a similar rate to Sweden or France, all fossil fuel electricity could be displaced in 25-34 years, reducing carbon emissions by half.
First-born siblings show better second language skills than later born siblings
TIL that flossing is not supported by scientific evidence. It offers little to no benefits over daily toothbrushing alone.
Computer scientists find that 1980 music had the lowest stylistic diversity of any other decade.
Targeted antibiotic treatment plans could be used to reduce antibiotic resistant genotypes in bacteria.
For the first time, astronomers have detected visible light directly from an exoplanet. The effort is a proof of concept for a new way to detect exoplanets.
Review finds that intake of vitamin and mineral supplements are generally associated with an increased risk of cancer and heart disease.
Chimpanzees from a troop in Senegal make and use spears.
Scientists have captured the first MRI video of a joint cracking, finally resolving that the "pop" is caused by a bubble forming in the joint's synovial fluid.
Smiling makes you look older. Smiling people were perceived as 1-2 years older than when they had a neutral expression.

WRITING.TEXT: Bottled water is one of those uniquely American enterprises that's a mx of marketing genius and questionably legal tactics.

WRITING.TITLE: A study of university faculty members finds that they are more likely to hire a woman over a man as an assistant professor in engineering, psychology, or biology by a margin of 2 to 1.
If marijuana is a schedule 1 drug, caffeine should definitely be one, too.
New study finds an association between eating out at restaurants and high blood pressure.
The Science Behind the Perfect French Fry
Researchers take another step toward functional nanobots. They outfitted bacterial spores with tiny flecks of graphene armor capable of activating electrodes
After using search engines, people overestimate their ability to explain ideas.
We Should Have a Better Condom by Now. Heres Why We Dont.
Fast food is just as effective as exercise supplements at helping athletes recover after a workout. In a study, there were no differences in muscle glycogen levels and subsequent performance.
A glimpse inside a macroscopic quantum state: Researchers detect particle entanglement in a beam of squeezed light
Simple Messages Help Set the Record Straight about Scientific Agreement on Human-Caused Climate Change: The Results of Two Experiments
Neurofeedback training could potentially be used as a treatment for criminal psychopaths. In a new study, psychopaths who used it experienced reductions in aggression and impulsivity.
Contrary to popular belief that regular pornography use can give men erectile dysfunction in partner situations, a new study finds no link between the two.
